intro: Zephyranthes yaviensis, commonly known as the Yaviensia rain lily, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom during the rainy season. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink and have a delicate, fragrant scent. Zephyranthes yaviensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in moist, well-drained soils.
